awd_titl_txt: Continued Studies of the Exposure Ages Geomorphic Surfaces  Using Cosmogenic 3He
awd_abstract_narration: Continued studies of cosmogenic 3He in surface rocks are planned                for the purpose of determining the exposure history of minerals                 to cosmic radiation.  The previous 18 months work has documented                that cosmogenic 3He can be used to date glacial events, volcanic                eruptions, flood events, and can better constrain the erosion and               transport history of mineral grains in the surface environment.                 Our studies will concentrate on constraining the production rate                of cosmogenic helium as a function of time, altitude, and                       latitude.  Furthermore, we will continue our studies on dating                  geomorphic events and on the erosion and transport processes of                 minerals in eolian, riverine, and beach deposits.
